definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: He threw caution to the winds and began arguing with the manager.
sentences.chinese: 他什麼也不顧了，和經理爭辯起來。

sentences.english: For it is the day of the LORD's vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.
sentences.chinese: 因耶和華有報仇之日，爲錫安的爭辯，有報應之年。

sentences.english: I have never seen anyone die for the ontologi-cal argument.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有見過有人爲本體論的爭辯而死。

sentences.english: One of the parents came to the school to expostulate about his son's examination results with the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 有一個家長到學校來爲他兒子的考試成績和老師爭辯。

sentences.english: Ad hominem attacks are a signal of defeat in a debate.
sentences.chinese: 偏激的抨擊是則是爭辯中失敗的象徵。

sentences.english: Liu didn't even argue with him; instead Liu stepped off the cart and walked home.
sentences.chinese: 劉寬也不和他爭辯，就下車走路回家。

sentences.english: He often remonstrated with others about unimportant matter.
sentences.chinese: 他常與別人爭辯一些無關緊要的問題。

sentences.english: She expostulated about her daughter's examination results with the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她和老師爭辯關於她女兒的學習成績。

sentences.english: It is beyond argument that every human being is a composite of good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都是善與惡的混合體，這是無可爭辯的事實。

sentences.english: "Don't friend the boss, " they would argue.
sentences.chinese: “別把老闆加成好友，”他們會爭辯道。

sentences.english: Arguments do not bring people to God. This is a good example for the evangelists.
sentences.chinese: 爭辯不能把人歸向主，福傳者學習的榜樣。

sentences.english: It seemed to me that Sir Robert's arguments were nonsensical.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，羅伯特爵士的爭辯純屬瞎說。

sentences.english: The lawyer's cogent arguments convince the jury.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師強有力的爭辯博得陪審團之信服。

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming more intense. He started to argue with groom’s father.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越來越急促，他同親家公爭辯起來。

sentences.english: Avoid arguing and having to being right about every topic.
sentences.chinese: 避免爭辯和要求自己的每一個話題都正確。

definition: to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
